svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - September 6 2020
September 6 2020

title: "Week in Ethereum News
September 6, 2020" date: "2020-09-06"
Eth News and Links
Eth1
‚Ä¢ Turbogeth weekly alpha release , upgrade to latest geth, experimental hdd sync, more RPC APIs
‚Ä¢ Getting started with Turbogeth on Ubuntu (~700 gigs storage for archive node)
‚Ä¢ Latest core devs call . Beiko‚Äôs notes , lots of discussion about EIPs below (gas cost increases!)
‚Ä¢ Alexandria , a sketch of state network over latest version of discovery protocol
EIPs/Standards
‚Ä¢ EIP suggested process changes: change abandoned to withdrawn and removing implementation as a core requirement
‚Ä¢ EIP2926 : Chunk-Based Code Merkleization
‚Ä¢ EIP2929 : Gas cost increases for state access opcodes
‚Ä¢ EIP2930 : Optional access lists
‚Ä¢ EIP2935 : Save historical block hashes in state
‚Ä¢ EIP2936 : EXTCLEAR Opcode For SELFDESTRUCTed contracts
‚Ä¢ EIP2937 : SET_INDESTRUCTIBLE opcode
‚Ä¢ EIP2938 : Account abstraction ( Evaluating account abstraction DoS vectors )
‚Ä¢ ERC2942 : EthPM URI Specification
Eth2
‚Ä¢ Latest what‚Äôs new in eth2
‚Ä¢ Danny Ryan‚Äôs quick update - Medalla testnet is stable but eth2 needs client diversity and you are incentivized to pick a non-majority
client
‚Ä¢ Images and guide to validating on Raspberry Pi4 with Lighthouse/ Nimbus/ Prysm/ Teku
‚Ä¢ Latest eth2 call . Notes from Ben and Mamy
‚Ä¢ Shuffling in eth2
‚Ä¢ An overview of attestation
‚Ä¢ Phase1: understanding shards as ‚Äúdata availability layer ‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Fizzy wasm interpreter v0.4
‚Ä¢ Shargri-la : shard simulator with an analysis of eth2 transaction fees
Layer2
‚Ä¢ StarkWare‚Äôs Cairo STARK prover for generalized computation
‚Ä¢ Rollup diff compression
‚Ä¢ Using that compression, optimistic rollup Fuel benchmarks 2500 tps for token transfers
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Trail of Bits !
Conduct your own minimum viable security audit . Follow this process from Trail of Bits to invest in your own security, particularly when
time is short and help may not be available.
Stuff for developers
‚Ä¢ Solidity v0.7.1 : functions can be defined at file level, copy calldata structs to storage
‚Ä¢ New maintainer Chainsafe‚Äôs roadmap (TypeScript) for web3JS, now with a v1.3 release candidate
‚Ä¢ Truffle v5.1.43 , better Solidity v0.7 support
‚Ä¢ CompoundJS
‚Ä¢ rDai‚Äôs library to track interest
‚Ä¢ Using external adapters in Chainlink
‚Ä¢ Trail of Bits recommended process for developing secure Eth code
‚Ä¢ Unique sorting in Solidity using value arrays
‚Ä¢ BLS sigs in Solidity
Ecosystem
‚Ä¢ Crazy gas fees this week: Matcha has free limit orders during this time of gas spikes. Dharma app has free trades as well
‚Ä¢ Remco Bloemen‚Äôs detailed tour through scaling layer1
‚Ä¢ Livepeer‚Äôs analysis of how to deal with crazy gas prices
Application layer
‚Ä¢ Uniswap hit #1 on DefiPulse because of SushiSwap
‚Ä¢ SushiSwap cashes out all of the accrued ‚Äú10% to themselves‚Äù tokens for 38k ETH (Irony: they used Uniswap via ZapperFi). Many call it an
exit scam . Sushi founder says he will stay involved, and has now transferred control to FTX‚Äôs Sam Bankman-Fried . There are rumors of who
the Sushi founder is; he denies it.
‚Ä¢ A few Uniswap/Sushiswap clones. No link necessary.
‚Ä¢ An attempt to put a token on top of Uniswap v2
‚Ä¢ Swerve , a new fork of Curve, reached almost $500m in total value locked in under a week.
‚Ä¢ Pine is live on mainnet (formerly UniswapEx) limit orders on Uniswap v1 and v2
‚Ä¢ Brave at 18m+ monthly active users
Tokens/Business/Regulation
‚Ä¢ the web3 sustainability loop
‚Ä¢ a yearn/YFI yield harvesting explainer
Crypto/General
‚Ä¢ Explaining Halo2 , a SNARK without trusted setup (replaces SONIC with PLONK)
‚Ä¢ ZenGo‚Äôs DogByte attack on VDF‚Äôs mpc ceremony
‚Ä¢ Man in the middle ransom attack on Trezor/KeepKey
‚Ä¢ CipherTrace announces product to track Monero transactions
‚Ä¢ Understanding Ethereum by studying Geth
Job Listings
‚Ä¢ Want to work in DeFi? mStable is hiring a Protocol Developer
‚Ä¢ Props is hiring full-stack , Product Manager , Finance Lead and Marketing Lead .
‚Ä¢ DAIswaps@gmail.com - Seeking skilled eth devs for DEX/DeFi. fulltime üßôü§ëü§ñ
‚Ä¢ Trail of Bits is looking for blockchain security engineers & an R&D engineer
‚Ä¢ 0x is hiring devs! Full-stack, back-end, front-end or Solidity
‚Ä¢ Inspire Chainlink's community as a Head of DevRel & Dev Evangelist
‚Ä¢ Celer Network: hiring Solidity and Go devs. Email: hiring@celer.network
Want your job listing here ? $250 per line (~75 character limit including spaces), payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to evan.ethereum.eth.
Questions? thecryptonewspodcast at-gmail
My Nifty.ink artwork on sale (and newsletter sponsorships)
I drew the Eth rainbow logo using nifty.ink [very noob friendly; send to your artist friends!] and put in on sale. You can buy it or watch
how I made it here: https://nifty.ink/QmeYK5yHCoZ1Upe1cHcoQvi7hPVvwmAxfZFtUd3DB5K2iS
The available sponsorship slots have been for this newsletter have been tokenized as $EVAN. You can now buy enough for a newsletter OTC
from me at the spot price, or directly on Balancer - but you‚Äôll likely get a better price from me.
Follow me on twitter: @evan_van_ness
Permalink for this week‚Äôs issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-september-6-2020/
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive it weekly
Dates of Note
Upcoming¬†dates of note ( new/changes in bold ) :
‚Ä¢ Sep 17 - Q&A for devs new to Ethereum
‚Ä¢ Oct 1-30 - EthOnline hackathon
‚Ä¢ Nov 6-7 - virtual Trufflecon
‚Ä¢ Nov 16 - MetaMask Provider breaking changes
Week in Ethereum News
